register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: IP Revision

register.description: Clock management configuration

bitfield.description: Master interface power management, standby/Wait control
IDLE protocol configuration
Software reset.

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector, line 0. Raw status is set even if event is not enabled by setting the register.

bitfield.description: Event generated by BYS_B
Event generated by the CSI2_C receiver
Event generated by BYS_A

HS or VS synchronization event. This event is triggered if a rising or falling edge is detected on the HS or VS signal (after the video port mux). The rising or falling edge and the HS or VS signal selection is chosen with the ISS_CTRL[1:0] SYNC_DETECT bit field.
Event generated by the CCP2 receiver
Event generated by SIMCOP
Event generated by SIMCOP
Event generated by SIMCOP
Event generated by SIMCOP
Event generated by the burst translation engine
Event generated by the circular buffer
Event generated by the CCP2 receiver
Event generated by the CCP2 receiver
Event generated by the CCP2 receiver
Event generated by the CCP2 receiver
Event generated by the CSI2_B receiver
Event generated by the CSI2_A receiver
Combined interrupt event provided by the ISP.
Combined interrupt event provided by the ISP.
Combined interrupt event provided by the ISP.
Combined interrupt event provided by the ISP.

register.description: ISS control register

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum number of tags that could be used by the CSI2_B write bridge. Note: Tag count must be set to 16 for best performance.
Defines the maximum number of tags that could be used by the CSI2_A write bridge. Note: Tag count must be set to 16 for best performance.
Defines the maximum number of tags that could be used by the CCP2 write bridge Note: Tag count must be set to 16 for best performance.
Defines the maximum number of tags that could be used by the CCP2 read bridge Note: Tag count must be set to 16 for best performance.
Defines the maximum number of tags that could be used by the CSI2_C write bridge.
Selects ISP input

bitenum.description: Input selected by the [3:2] INPUT_SEL register bit-field in this register

bitfield.description: ISS functional clock division CLK refers to the input clock provided to the ISS. FCLK is the functional clock provided to ISS top level and submodules. CFGCLK is the clock used for the configuration network.
Selects ISP input
Chooses among rising and falling edge for the HS_VS_IRQ synchronization event

register.description: ISS clock control register. Use to enable/disable the interface and functional clock of ISS submodules.

bitfield.description: Enables the pixel clock from the parallel interface
Enables the pixel clock from the CCP2 protocol engine
Enables the pixel clock from the CSI2_B protocol engine
Enables the pixel clock from the CSI2_A protocol engine
Enables the pixel clock from the CSI2_C protocol engine

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already off.
Request enable of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already off.
Request enable of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already off.
Request enable of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already off.
Request enable of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already off.
Request enable of the submodule. No effect if the submodule clock is already on.

register.description: ISS clock status register.

bitfield.description: Status of the pixel clock from the parallel interface
Status of the pixel clock from the CCP2 protocol engine
Status of the pixel clock from the CSI2_B protocol engine
Status of the pixel clock from the CSI2_A protocol engine
Status of the pixel clock from the CSI2_C protocol engine

register.description: ISS power manager status register. Software could know what modules are in functional or STANDBY/IDLE state. This feature could be particularly useful to debug when ISS does not go into STANDBY mode

bitfield.description: Power status of the CSI2_C module
Power status of the CBUFF.
Power status of the BTE.
Power status of the SIMCOP.
Power status of the ISP.
Power status of the CCP2.
Power status of the CSI2_B module
Power status of the CSI2_A module

register.description: BYS IO selection

bitfield.description: Selects input of CSI2_C BYS input
Selects input of CSI2_B BYS input
Selects input of CSI2_A BYS input
Selects BYS_B input
Selects BYS_A input
